evidence_list.name: Poisoned Wine Glass
evidence_list.description: Crystal wine glass containing traces of cyanide. Richard Marshall's fingerprints clearly visible.
evidence_list.significance: Primary murder weapon, directly implicates client
evidence_list.additional_info: Matches set used at dinner party

evidence_list.name: Cyanide Container
evidence_list.description: Small bottle labeled 'Jewelry Cleaner' containing cyanide residue. Found in Richard's luggage.

evidence_list.name: Threatening Letter
evidence_list.description: Handwritten note from Richard to Thomas threatening 'consequences' over business disagreement.
evidence_list.additional_info: Handwriting appears to match Richard's business signature

case_summary: Victim: Thomas Grayson, 45, died of cyanide poisoning at his birthday dinner. Client Richard Marshall found holding matching wine glass, with poison source in his room and threatening letter as evidence.
